Description: UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA-DAVIS WILL PROVIDE 10 FELLOWS FROM VIETNAM WITHAN INTEGRATED <(>&<)> DIVERSE OVERVIEW OF CRITICAL KNOWLEDGE INVETERINARY AND ANIMAL SCIENCES PRACTICE <(>&<)> TEACHING WITH THEIMMEDIATE AIM OF REVISING AND MODERNIZING CLASS OUTLINES FORINTRODUCTION AT FELLOWS’ HOME UNIVERSITIES UPON RETURN TO VIETNAM.IMPROVED KNOWLEDGE AND CLASSROOM DELIVERY SUPPORT THE BROADER GOAL OFIMPROVING ANIMAL AND HUMAN HEALTH BOTH AT THE COUNTRY LEVEL AND ININTERNATIONAL TRADE FACILITATION. DISCUSSION OF UC DAVIS’S UNIQUECOMPARATIVE AND PROBLEM-BASED APPROACH CENTERED ON BODY SYSTEMS RATHERTHAN DISCIPLINES AT THE DVM LEVEL: WHY THIS BLOCK APPROACH WAS CHOSEN,HOW IT DIFFERS FROM OTHER VET. SCHOOLS, IMPROVED ASSESSMENT METHODS, ANDOBSERVED OUTCOMES AND IMPACTS ON VETERINARIANS.

Description: THROUGH THEIR PARTICIPATION IN FEP AT UT, FELLOWS WILL GAIN A DETAILED,HOLISTIC UNDERSTANDING OF U.S. VETERINARY EDUCATION AND RESEARCH, ASWELL AS ANIMAL HEALTH REGULATION, THAT CAN BE READILY ADAPTED TO THEIRHOME INSTITUTIONS. THESE OUTCOMES WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGHPARTICIPATION IN FACULTY MENTORSHIPS, PERSONALIZED COURSEWORK, SEMINARSAND WORKSHOPS, DIAGNOSTIC AND RESEARCH LABORATORY EXPERIENCE, NATIONALCONFERENCE ATTENDANCE, AND EXTENSION VISITS WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERSTHROUGHOUT TENNESSEE.
